synopsis: In this enlightening episode of the podcast, Devam and Ahir delve into the complexities of anxiety, sharing their personal experiences and insights on how it shapes their lives. With a blend of humor and vulnerability, they explore the importance of acknowledging emotions and the journey toward self-acceptance and healing.
quotes: You don't have to worry about this; you know there's nothing wrong.
Anxiety is like a fog; you have to learn to see through it.
It's okay to cry; you're supposed to feel that grief.
Every day gets a little easier, but you got to do it every day.
It's not just about how well you fight it, but about taking that effort every day.
Sometimes the hardest part is just being able to express how you feel.
You can get the same things out of life without the anxiety.
You can’t control everything, but you can control how you respond.
Being able to embrace your sadness is essential for healing.
It’s a battle on many fronts; anxiety changes shape and hides in different places.
